sentences.english: He does exceedingly abundantly above and beyond what we could ever ask, imagine or think!
sentences.chinese: 神能充充足足的成就一切，超过我们所求所想的。

sentences.english: Five million barrels of oil gushed into the ocean over 86 straight days.
sentences.chinese: 约有5百万桶石油在足足86天内泄入大海。

sentences.english: At the edge of human pointing, Zhang Fei had spent 50 yuan of money.
sentences.chinese: 在边上人的指点下，张飞足足花了50多元钱。

sentences.english: Then he came back over here, and cried, easily, for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 后来他又返回那儿，放声大哭，足足哭了两个小时。

sentences.english: We have walked three kilometres clear.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经足足步行了三公里。

sentences.english: The motor ran 450 solid days on end.
sentences.chinese: 马达连续运转了足足450天。

sentences.english: The sunlit pedestal drops three more stories to the cave floor.
sentences.chinese: 这一块阳光照射的基石离洞底足足三层楼高。

sentences.english: He lavished His grace on us with all wisdom and understanding.
sentences.chinese: 这恩典是神用诸般智慧聪明，充充足足赏给我们的。

sentences.english: Javert watched the quarter for more than a month.
sentences.chinese: 沙威注视着那地区足足有一个多月。

sentences.english: Eyeing the four-inch-thick wad of paper, I felt a wave of despair.
sentences.chinese: 望着这沓足足十公分厚的信纸，我忽然认为一阵失望。

sentences.english: The manager kicked this suggestion around for an hour before making a final decision.
sentences.chinese: 经理在做出最终决定前对此建议足足考虑了一个小时。

sentences.english: For five months after the move to Beijing, he was not allowed a bath.
sentences.chinese: 从他搬到北京后，足足有五个月，他没能洗上一次澡。

sentences.english: Yea, really a lot time, four months and seven days.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，真的有好久了，足足四个月零七天啊。

sentences.english: Fully a quarter of his models led to long-lived stars, but with an important caveat.
sentences.chinese: 他的模型中足足有四分之一都可以产生长寿恒星。

sentences.english: Home start the rice, I a full ate half Pot Rice.
sentences.chinese: 家里做起了饭，我足足吃了半锅饭。

sentences.english: Mr. Ivey himself said that his own college relationship lasted three years.
sentences.chinese: 艾维说他大学的恋爱维持了足足三年。

definition: almost/nearly/more or less/about the same/good enough/not bad
a portion smaller than a half/the lesser part/the smaller part
to extend as long as/to lengthen out to
at the minimum/at the very least
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/in spite of everything/in that crazy way/actually/to go as far as to
